newsitem.title: USA: Evergreen selling stock to fund Viacom deal.
newsitem.headline: Evergreen selling stock to fund Viacom deal.

text.p: Evergreen Media Corp said Tuesday it plans to make a private placement of 4.0 million preferred shares, proceeds of which it would use to partly pay for radio stations it is buying from Viacom International Inc, a unit of Viacom Inc.
The placement is expected to produce net proceeds of about $193 million, Evergreen Media said. An additional 600,000 shares may be sold to cover any increased demand, it said.

In February, Evergreen agreed to buy 10 radio properties owned by the Viacom unit in a deal worth $1.075 billion. The deal was hatched after Evergreen and Chancellor Broadcasting Co agreed to merge. To comply with federal ownership requirements, Evergreen has been making purchases and sales of radio stations since the merger was announced.

The shares to be placed will be convertible into Evergreen's Class A common stock and, under certain circumstances, will be exchangeable, at Evergreen's option, for convertible subordinated debentures of Evergreen.
The placement will not be registered and the stock may not be sold without being registered or without being exempted from registration by regulators, it said.
